text:
Hello, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today I am going to be making something from
team Fortress 2 if you haven’t

guessed! I got a lot of requests for
a Team Fortress cake, so today
I make you a sandwich!

Today, I pre-made yellow cake using box cake
mix.

The tools I use today, will be toothpick,
cake level, cutty thingy, and Sasha.
My baby Sasha.

Now we will take level, put it down, I think
I’ve adjusted the height alright,

and begin to cut! You hold you cake in place
and you just kind of
jiggle, jiggle, back and forth, jiggle, jiggle, jiggle, walk it along.

And when you’re cutting this you just want
to make sure that your cake has had time

to completely cool before you cut it. Otherwise
it will just
fall apart.

Baaaaaaam! It’s leveled! Now you take pretty
Sasha, my little baby, and you

cut the shape of your sandwich. We’re gonna
cut this sandwich in 1/2!

And then we’re gonna cut the shape to kind of make
it look more like bread.

Take off the excess. Sasha is doing nice job!
Oop! Ohp, ohp, Sasha is very bad girl!

She has to sit in time out some time, because
I have to….
OK I cut now!

Once you’ve made your cake look like a slice
of bread, it is time to frost.

I am using vanilla buttercream frosting. And
remember when you’re frosting these,

we’re gonna be using fondant, you don’t
want to use any whipped, you want to
use anything rich and creamy!

After you’re done frosting your cake, I
put it in the fridge to cool for about

15 minutes, and now I’m gonna roll out the
different colors of fondant.
Starting with tan, my sandwich color.

I put powdered sugar down, on the table, so
that the fondant won’t stick to

the table. It’s also on top of a pastry
mat, if you don’t have a pastry mat,

you can just use a piece of wax paper. No
big deal!

Now that we’ve rolled out all the fondant,
yes, it is time to cut it out,

with Sasha! I’ve got my first piece of bread…
And I’m just gonna eyeball it!

Ta-da! Piece of bread, now he just needs a
piece of crust!
Now we will roll out crust!

So we’re just rolling the brown one out
to be as long as possible, because we’re
gonna cut about inch strips, all the way down.
And put them around the edge of the cake.

This is kind of a baking mess, but I have
rolled out, all of the different types of

colors of fondant that I will need. Over here,
dun-da-doo-da-doo!

Over here we have, this will be the lettuce,
the meat, for the sandwich,
the crust, ze tomato, baaaa!
And, the cheese!
Now it’s time to cut out our shapes.

Boom! We got meat, we got cheese, we got bread,
we got crust, we even got tomatoes!

Last 2 things, we need the top slice, and…
Look how cute he is!?!?

I made a little fondant olive! He’s so cute!
So we stick him on the toothpick

like so. Oh, he’s ready to go! You’re
gonna take this piece of bread,

and what I did with this cake, I put it in
the freezer to get harder, so it

wouldn’t lose shape. And hopefully I’m
just gonna be able to pick it up…
Oh yeah! Put it on top!
What!?!?! Oh my gosh, this looks so cute!
Huh, ta-da!

I make sandwich for you. Om-yom-yom-yom-yom-yom-yom-yom-yom!
So delicious!

Thanks you guys for watching, I had a lot
of fun.

If you have any other suggestions, or ideas
for any other Nerdy Nummies,

please leave me a comment and let me know
and I will do my best to make it happen.
Thank you so much!
Bye-bye!
